results.description:
As someone who has recently moved to the border of Prospect and Crown heights, I get the appeal of meeting new people in my own neighborhood. I’m sure you do too, so let's get it done. No longer shall we ladies have to hop on the subway for 45 minutes to meet someone for a beer! It's time to explore our own backyards!

Meetup is filled of groups with members in the hundreds and even thousands who never actually meet each other -- forget that. Let's make some genuine friendships and real connections with activities that go beyond casual drinks once a month (my liver can't take it). For this reason, I plan on being pretty selective regarding membership, so if you're truly interested in joining our meetup group, show us! Come out and actually, like, you know, like, meet up ! lol

• Please make sure to have a CLEAR photo of your FACE,

• be between the ages of 21-35ish,

• live in the PCB or surrounding areas,

• and answer all questions to the best of your ability.

See ya soon!
results.name: Young Women of BedStuy, Crown, and Prospect Heights

results.description:
Newbies and experienced Law of Attraction appliers are welcome. The group will focused on a two hour practice of the law of attraction using the 22 processes of Abraham Hicks and any other technique that can help create the feeling of he project being something from the present and alive  and speed up the manifestation of our goals.

During the session we will include EFT tapping, relaxation techniques, short meditations, visualizations and affirmations among other.

The sessions alternate languages. SOME of them are held IN ENGLISH and SOME of them IN SPANISH so pay attention to the description of the event.

Este grupo sirve tanto a los principiantes como a las personas con experiencia trabajando La Ley de La Atracción. La idea es que en un lapso de dos horas trabajemos en nuestros objetivos aplicando La Ley de la Atracción, los 22 procesos de Abraham Hicks y cualquier otra técnica que pueda ayudar a crear el sentimiento de estar viviendo ese proyecto y así acelerar la manifestación de lo que deseamos.

Durante la sesión se incluirán La Técnica de Liberación Emocional, técnicas de relajación, meditaciones, visualizaciones y afirmaciones entre otras.

Los encuentros alternan el idioma. Algunos encuentros son en INGLÉS y otras son en ESPAÑOL por eso presta atención a la descripción del evento.
results.name: New York Law of Attraction Workshop Meetup

results.description: This is a group of people (30’s & 40’s+) who want to simply get together to have fun, laugh, and explore Montclair and beyond. Our goal: • Each person that joins the group will connect with other members and develop authentic friendships • Networking We will be enjoying day and night parties, brunches, dinning out, movies-nights, game nights, museums, community service, out of town trips, potluck, wine tasting on Long Island vineyards, and etc. We welcome ALL to the group. We will also enjoy Women Only functions to build sisterhood.

results.description: Calling all domino aficionados...love the game? ChikyBoom Cuban & Tapas is sponsoring domino nights on the first and third Mondays of each month, from 6:30-8pm. Socialize and play with the best domino enthusiasts. Light dinner, snacks, coffee & drinks served. Cover is $15.
results.name: Red Bank Domino Group

results.description:
Hi! This group is for recent (or even not too recent) New Yorkers who happen to have been born/raised in Philly or the local surrounding areas. Let's meet up, reminisce about the good ol' days, and do some very Philly things such as visiting the Statue of Liberty, walking the Brooklyn Bridge, or catching a Broadway play. We're probably not going to be doing any of those things but I assure you we'll have a good time anyway!

To avoid random people who love to binge-join hundreds of different groups with no intention of actually coming out, membership is granted only after providing somewhat thoughtful answers to the questions provided. In addition all new members will also get to be event organizers as well! I want a real community feel where everyone is able to contribute. Come join!
results.name: We're from Philly! (NYC Meetup Group)

topics.name: Small Groups - Book Club, Discuss Issues

results.description:
Welcome everybody! I didn't really see any kind of group like this on Meetup, so I thought it'd be cool to have a slightly different video game based group on here! 

So this group is exactly what the title might suggest. It's like a book club, except for video games! What that means is that we'll be planning meet-ups once a month at a local bookstore, game shop or public library so we can talk about some game or games that we've all been playing for that month! This is meant to be a relaxing, casual get-together where you can meet new people, share a common interest with new friends, and maybe even learn some new things about your favorite game(s)! 

I do ask that everyone signing up for the group have a clear picture of themselves on their profile so that we can recognize members for each meetup. I'll be taking suggestions from the sign-up questions on what our games for each month are going to be, and we'll go from there. Other than that, all we ask is that you're ready to have a good time and talk about games! Hope to see you at a meetup!
results.name: Video Game "Book Club" NYC

Forest Hills! Great neighborhood in a great borough. As per there norm in NYC there are always great new, or old, places to experience and new people to meet. If you're interested in meeting new and interesting people in and around the neighborhood then this should be a great opportunity to make new acquaintances and possibly lasting relationships. Will look to set up various meetups at restaurants or bars in the area (though this isn't a rule set in stone). 


Please, if you RSVP YES to a dining event, please honor that YES rsvp where there is a restaurant reservation involved. If you are unable to make it to a scheduled event, thus keeping you from joining us, please be considerate to your fellow members by updating your rsvp at least 1 day before the event is scheduled to start.

results.description: This is a group for like-minded Christians to come together for fellowship, fun, and Kingdom building. It is a group that has no official church space. Lighthouse Christian Fellowship looks beyond the four walls of a building in order to affect lives in the community through person to person interaction, making disciples and empowering disciples of Christ to use their God-given authority to bring about change in the lives of others. But it's more than that...LCM uses the first century church as a model for a Christian lifestyle. Anyone who joins LCM can expect fun and fellowship, as well as growth, sound doctrine, and more importantly a life changing experience with the support and guidance of other brothers and sisters, who demonstrate that Christianity does not consist of a bunch of boring religious practices, but that it can be fun and fulfilling as well.
results.name: Lighthouse Christian Fellowship

results.description:
"The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams." – Eleanor Roosevelt 

Calling on all the motivated individuals who want to achieve and be more in 2016! 

Are you passionate about making your dreams a reality in the new year? You are not alone. Thorough this group you can join others who are like minded and will support you. Studies show that the most dependable way to achieve your goals is through peer support - people who have similar goals and will keep you accountable. This group will host regular meetings and give you access to resources such as scientific ways to set goals, strategies to stay motivated, brainstorming support, and accountability. 

* Who should join: If you are serious about achieving your goals in 2015, and would love to have a group to support you, this is for you! 

* Why should members join: Learn more about specific strategies to set goals and stay committed. Brainstorm and mastermind with like minded individuals. 

* What can members expect out of the group: Typical activities include - meet and greet, share your goals, brainstorming and mastermind sessions. 

* Power of community: This group is meant to bring people together who are supportive of each other's goals and value peer learning along with peer feedback. You will develop long term friendships with positive people who want to make a difference in their own life. 

About myself: I have been successfully organizing one of the most highly rated NY Connect and Learn Business Networking Group on meetup with 4500+ members.
results.name: New York Goals Support Meetup

Meet New Nannies in the Same Age Group
Nanny Group for Socializing and Friendship

results.description: Calling all nannies (or mannies) in NYC! If you are looking to connect with other nannies in your area to make friends, talk about work, or make playdates, this is the group for you! Sometimes being a nanny can be lonely when all you have are the kids to talk to all day, so I'm hoping this meetup will help people make friends and connections. It will be open to anyone to create a meetup, and I encourage anyone with a good idea to suggest it and I will make you an event host. Also if anyone is interested in becoming a co-organizer to be able to create events more often, let me know! I have lived in the city for over 8 years and have worked in childcare/as a nanny for most of it so I will find some fun things for us to do and can't wait to see what you come up with as well.
results.name: Nannies in NYC

results.description: I'm new to Sunnyside and I'm a Yoga teacher. I have a spacious living room and I do not plan to get a sofa, so might as well host Yoga classes here! We will practice Yin Yoga, Restorative Yoga, and Gentle Yoga. I also plan to host meditation sittings, guided breathwork, and discussions over tea. Most classes will have a fee and some events will be free or by donation. I'm looking forward to meeting my neighbors!

results.description: All of you that want to do any personal work (therapy) - using the Core Energetics Approach. Its a therapy using consciousness, body and heart. We will start with Bioenergetic warmup to get us in into ou body and then we will work in a group - sometimes individually and sometimes in a dyad or triad. Its a therapy that lets us release whats been held in our body. As we all know our body hold alot for us.
results.name: Core Therapy Meetup

results.description:
•First and foremost, this is kind of an experiment for me - I was introduced to Meetup in 2015 and attended a whole bunch of Meetups, ranging from '80s dance parties to language events to ski outings, etc. I was trying to meet new and interesting people with an actual interest in making long term friends, but that didn't really happen. So, one of my resolutions for 2016 was to create this group and interact with sane, normal people looking to make genuine friendships.

I'm hoping there are some normal folks out there looking to make new friends, either because their old ones moved away, or their friends all got married and became boring, or through some crazy mishmash of circumstances find themselves without some solid people to hang with. 


This group is for those in their 20s/30s and fit the criteria below: 

• You are sane - this is rule #1; if you're a creep or a narcissistic psychopath, this isn't the Meetup for you, sorry.

• You're actually interested in building real, genuine friendships, and not here to meet some new people you hang out with for a month and then suddenly stop. (Of course, if you just don't click with them that's a different matter altogether).

• You are not a bigot - All are welcome as long as you're willing to try talking to new people and can respect others' viewpoints.

• You are single - as in, you're not engaged or married. I find married people are either busy doing nothing or doing their own thing that they forget about their friends (yes, this has happened to me). Sorry if you're married - hey, at least you've got your significant other to hang out with, right?

• You are not using this Meetup as some kind of dating venue - such activity won't be allowed. Besides, trying to sleep with your friends usually ends horribly. Many songs have been written about it - trust me on this one.
results.name: Sane People Who Want To Make Real, Genuine Friends

results.description: This meet-up is for all Kannadiga families around in NJ/NY. It will be fun meeting new people. Plan to organize lunches, dinners, potluck, movie , hike etc If you are someone who loves going out and meeting new people , then this group is for you !!

topics.name: Where lonely people make friends Be lonely no more

results.description:
If you're 60+ and on your own now, come share your bucket list with us, or make a new one.  Let's make 'em happen.  Anyone 60+ with things you'd like to do with a bunch of friends, come on in.  I'll just bet there will be other members who'll want to do the same things.  So let's do them together.

I'll schedule and organize our first meetup once 5 people join.  If we get a larger group we'll have a larger meetup.  The event will fit the group size.  If it's a big group, maybe we'll have 2 events.

Common interests breed friendships and that's what we're all about.  Meeting people like you, making new friends, building relationships - building people bridges.

results.description: NightShul is for everyone in Brooklyn’s progressive Jewish Community. (nightshul.org for more information and to register) You don’t have to belong to a synagogue. You don’t have to believe any specific thing, pray in any particular way, or profess any particular political persuasion. It’s for young adults, seniors and everybody in between, in every generational cohort. It’s a Jewish learning community, but you don’t have to be Jewish to love learning. We welcome those who are curious and open-minded. We especially welcome people whose significant other is Jewish and who want to know more of what it’s about. Come be part of this growing community, make friends, learn and have fun. Each evening begins with a wine and cheese hour at 7:00pm, and the learning begins at 8:00pm. NightShul Adult Learning Community's January Meetup begins on January 14 at the East Midwood Jewish Center, 1625 Ocean Avenue. Meetup will continue weekly on Thursday evenings through January 28. For detailed information and to sign up, go to nightshul.org
results.name: NightShul Learning Community at East Midwood Jewish Center

We hope that running with our group becomes a great motivator for you to stay engaged in running/fitness and provides an exciting environment where you will have fun making new friends.

results.description:
This class is for anyone who has either never taken a Meditation class before or would like to learn and experience Meditation with a renowned Meditation teacher who has taught Meditation to people around the world. Our Meditation classes are led Thupten Phuntsok, an ordained Tibetan Buddhist monk.

The goal of each class is to provide a regular meditation experience that will allow you to deepen your experience. It is a guided meditation that will relax you, allow you to focus on issues that you wish to address, and allow you to build loving kindness and compassion to others as well as yourself.

You may utilize our beautiful high quality Zabuton and Zafus, sit in a chair and use extra pillows for support, or even lay on the floor with a very soft cotton cushion to support you. Our goal is to help you to get into the most comfortable position possible so that you can sit as still as possible and just relax.

You can read our FAQ section to learn more about The Compassion Center and our Meditation classes.
results.name: Staten Island Meditation

results.description:
Girlfriends Pray (GP) Local is everywhere, for every woman, in every season of her life! Once a month our Local Ambassadors host a Saturday morning meet-up in cities all around the world to discuss prayer, and connect with women in their local communities for fellowship, food, and fun on the strength of our faith.

It is the mission of Girlfriends Pray Ministries to get more women closer to God through prayer; and our vision is to get 1 million women around the world united in prayer. Although we are a non-traditional unconventional ministry with 80% of our service to women delivered virtually, in 2015 we expanded our service to women nationally and internationally off-line with our LIVE Breakfast Book Club (BBC) prayer groups. We encourage you to also partner with us as day after day we connect with women all around the global and come face-to-face with real life issues, challenges and the needs of women. So many women depend on Girlfriends Pray Ministries as a life line to God. Every day we see lives changed, lives impacted and souls led back to Jesus Christ through our local meet-ups and our prayer line, (712) 775-7031 access code 943334#. Here's a testimony from one of our girlfriends, Courtney -- “For those of you just joining Girlfriends Pray, if it had not been for God and this prayer line on my side …. Where would I be … in the grave by my own hand!”

We thank you in advance for joining us and your financial gift as an offering for the ongoing support of Girlfriends Pray Ministries. To become a partner please CLICK HERE.

We look forward to meeting you face-to-face at our next monthly meet-up.

Girlfriends Pray Local Ambassador Leadership Team
Praying Without Ceasing.... 1 Thessalonians 5:17
Girlfriends Pray Ministries
Prayer Line: (712) 775-7031 access code 943334#
Email: Local@GirlfriendsPray.org
Website: www.GirlfriendsPray.org
@GirlfriendsPray
results.name: Girlfriends Pray Jersey City, NJ – Breakfast Book Club (BBC)

Thursday, January 7, 2016 6:00 pm – 7:30 pm Kings Bay Library 3650 Nostrand Avenue (and Ave. W) Grief, bereavemnet peer support group First Thursday of each month. Kings Bay Library Join our support group to find some comfort and understanding among fellow survivors. The group is informal and completely free. No need to struggle alone. Come and share your story with other survivors for mutual support. Please call and speak with Liana at 718-368-1709 x 44116. Or please email Lisa at Lisa2172@aol.com No registration is required. The meetings will be held at the Meeting Room. Age Group: Adults, Older Adults

results.description: Welcome to your good health. Is your health important to you? Are you ready for a brand new you for 2016 and beyond? Let our local fitness and nutrition meetups help you make a great start to achieving your goals. With a wide variety of fitness and nutritional programs that support the five boroughs for the beginner, intermediate or advanced participate looking to get back in touch with yourself physically, create more balance in your life or maybe either by living a healthier lifestyle or just lose a few pounds, we have something special to offer you. Our program consists of impactful and high energy, free or low cost fitness and nutrition sessions in your area. Whether it is with popular fitness forms of Zumba, Yoga, Pilates, Cardio Workouts, African, Afro-Caribbean, Salsa, Capoeira, Hip Hop Dance, Jazz Fitness or One-on-One Personal Trainer Sessions. In addition to nutrition sessions addressing how to motivate yourself to simple healthier eating habits, how to reduce sugar, carbs and starch from your diet, starting a customized nutritional plan designed especially for your on the go lifestyle or maybe how sugar affects your body by dramatically accelerating the aging process of your organs and how measuring and managing your Advance Glycation Endproducts (A.G.E.) levels can help you to live younger, longer and reduce the risk of disease. We also provide you with holistic and natural ways to weight loss or weight management in addition how to reduce or manage stress in your life to gain order. With all this, we get you moving towards better health - either by managing good health or coming be into better health. This meetup is sponsored by Body Sculpt NY and Making a Difference with Morinda. Everyone who attends will receive a free gift on behalf of Body Sculpt and Making a Difference with Morinda including a free travel certificate  from Priceline and Morinda Travel, which you can use for booking discount airfare, hotels and car rentals ($2,500 value).  Many of our fundraiser programs also support a variety of charities locally and nationally.
results.name: New York Fitness & Nutrition Meetup (Live Younger Longer)

results.description: Do you want to know more about how we learn a second language? Did you always wonder why you were not able to learn that second language in school? results.description: This safe and inviting space where everyone can feel free to come as they are and move however they want. There is no judgment and the practice has nothing to do with being a "good" dancer. Dance is joyful and powerful, and it's definitely made all the richer when practiced in a group, where we reflect one another's beauty and hold space for each other's pain. To witness each other and to be seen, so that we can move through the world as our most authentic selves. It's a lot of fun, and also really cathartic, as we feel into our bodies and touch into the deepest parts of ourselves...igniting bliss and releasing any blocks we might be holding. This soulful dance party will draw from various traditions that can help fuel an awesome reconnection with body and soul, including 5Rhythms, Authentic Movement, Ancient Temple Arts, Qigong, and Meditation.
results.name: Brooklyn Ecstatic Dance Night

results.description:
Networking has become the cornerstone of all businesses and careers. Yet, the networking event has become a commodity. Many events around town focus on attracting volumes of attendees, exchanging business cards and potentially meeting someone new. Sure, it's great if your goals are aligned to any one or more of these results. However, you're probably asking yourself these two questions when you leave the event:

How many true connections did I make?
Was the event worth my time?

Chances are....you probably didn't get what you paid for (in time and money).

Our goal for NYC Startup Connectors is to create opportunities for entrepreneurs and other business professionals to connect in a more meaningful way. What do we mean by meaningful? Bringing people together for a defined purpose that aims to help you. Our events and activities focus on the art of connecting, rather than networking. (Quality over quantity). After all, establishing connections and building relationships shouldn't be about sales pitches or propositions, rather, what did you actually learn from the other person and how can you help them as well.

We will offer a variety of events throughout the year that primarily focus on the problems startups and entrepreneurs face. These experiences will involve local activities and tours that bring people together in different ways along with a few weekend escape trips that will get our connect our community outside the city.
results.name: NYC Startup Connectors

results.description: Indies In NY 2016 is hosted by TOJ Publishing Services, which is formulated by published authors who believe in helping future and existing indie authors achieve their dreams. Our Goal… As a servicing company to both self published and traditionally published authors, we believe in providing our clients with quality work that will help them standout. It is our goal to provide authors with opportunities to come together as a collective and celebrate the written word and it’s effectiveness in enriching the lives of the human experience.
results.name: Indies in NY 2016 Book Signing event

results.description: We are a group of performers that love throwing fun, unconventional meetups in NYC. No weirdos shoving business cards in your face here. Our meetups focus on fun activities that actually let you interact with and get to know cool, new people. Introverts welcome! It's a VIP experience, but we keep the vast majority of meetups free to attend, with drinks, etc. optional. Important: to keep the quality of our events high we limit the number of people who can attend. If you are interested in coming to our fun, social meetups in NYC then we recommend you joining now to save your spot.
results.name: Fun Networking for HR & Young Professionals in NYC

results.description: A filmmaking group for eager amateur / semi-pro filmmakers to collaborate with each other, produce, plan, inspire.

results.description: This is a group for women who want to transition into more meaningful, purpose driven work and do not know what the next steps are to get there.

results.description: In Living Color is a once a month after work party from 6pm to 11pm where young professionals, creatives and nightlife goers meet when in search of a bit more culture to add to their nightlife experience. Centered around the idea of “live art” through the use of live painting and a hip-hop DJ-violinist duo who follow behind Brooklyn celebrity DJ Trauma, the room is a buzz between hipsters, artists, taste makers and everyone in between. With great food and a great ambiance, don’t be surprised if you run into your next co-worker here as it’s great for networking.
results.name: "In Living Color" Live Art Party in Brooklyn

results.description:
The Ridgewood Singers is an SATB mixed voice community chorus of about 50 singers in Ridgewood, NJ. These happy singers welcome newcomers and make you feel right at home. Some of them perform with other area choruses too.

Rehearsals are well-paced and stimulating. There are two rehearsal seasons: September to December, and January to May, with two concerts per year --- in May & December. Rehearsals are 7:30 to 9:30 p.m. on Monday evenings in a wonderfully accommodating rehearsal space in West Side Presbyterian Church at 6 South Monroe Street, Ridgewood. 

Membership dues are $55 per season. SATB scores are loaned to singers when dues are paid.

The group performs a wide variety of music and some artistically and musically challenging pieces too (great way to grow!). Professional music director and professional accompanist (see bios under PAGES). Singers are warmly invited to sample a rehearsal to see how they like us (no obligation). 

We look forward to meeting you and sharing the joy of singing with you! 

For information, please send a message to Linda D. and we can exchange info and chat if you like. 

PAGES: Click on the PAGES tab on top of the home page, to find our professionals' bios, concert attire, and more information about TRS. Thank you.

www.theridgewoodsingers.com
results.name: The Ridgewood Singers

results.description: Drink-&-Draw is an event created by the New Rochelle Arts Collective, it's an uninstructed figure drawing session with a social twist. Our monthly sessions are 3hrs long in the evenings. Our models pose nude and at times in costume with props for 1min - 20mins poses. Our attendees range from local creatives seeking to brush up on their craft, to newcomers curious about this creative tradition. We provide the model and music, and you guys provide the good vibes. Our events are BYOB and BYOAS event (Bring Ya Own Art Supplies, NO acrylics or oil paints please) $15 at the door 18+ to enter; 21+ to drink
results.name: Westchester Drink & Draw

results.description: Never eat alone again! Connect with interesting people by eating together! New York is the best city for food. Don't waste it!  We'll get together and try different types of delicious food, from Food Trucks to Michelin-starred restaurants! Recommendations are always welcome!

I want to get together a group of motivated people who are interested and motivated in making a huge difference in the lives of young people. To give them hope and moments of happiness through compassion and love. I want to Meet up to brainstorm and discuss, plan , implement and execute various charity events for kids and teenagers. To let them know that they are not alone in this world. Let me know what you think..

results.description: Now that the weather has finally turned colder, join me for skiing during the weekdays for either a day trip to the Catskills or Berkshires or for a few days in Vermont. I can drive and take a few people leaving from the north Bronx.

results.description: The TV and media industries are going through the biggest transformation since the 1980s. Video is on the rise both from a user consumption perspective and for content publishers. 64% of the global mobile traffic is done for video. It will be 80% by 2019. Consumers of all ages are already "cutting the chord" and/or adding additional streaming services to meet their dynamic viewing habits (ie. Netflix, Hulu, Amazon Video, HBONow, etc.). The Over-The-Top (OTT) and video on demand (VOD) arenas are changing by the day, with many players moving into the space. New York is home to the leading media, TV, and content providers on the planet. This is a group for anyone interested in digital media, video, OTT/VOD, streaming services, etc. Feel free to network, talk strategy, and discuss trends. Wax your boards, the wave is coming ...
results.name: NY Over-The-Top (OTT) Video Meetup

results.description:
Rooted in empowerment and gratitude, abunDANCE is an organization using love, movement and other art forms to promote creativity, connection and abundance. Creating spaces for authenticity, outrageousness and joy. 

abunDANCE creates a safe space to release stress, weight or anything that doesn't belong to them through movement, empowerment and joy.

www.keomitarver.com/abundanceclass
results.name: abunDANCE through Dance in NYC

results.description: To meet, socialize & network with other working professionals that have facial piercings. This group is also open to those who are working professionals and want to consider getting facial piercings.

results.description: WHO WANTS TO PLAY INDOOR SOCCER NOW?? We already have a group that plays soccer during summer at the Nyack Middle School twice a week. We have been looking for an indoor place to play during winter, and now I was able to secure one night a week at the NYACK YMCA gym for an adult indoor soccer class. Games would be Thursdays nights from 8:15 pm to 10 pm. Games will be 5 a side. If there's more than 10 people we'll form three or four teams, to a limit of 20 people per night. Now, if you want to play you'll need to become a YMCA member, if you are not one already. You can see the membership rates here: http://www.rocklandymca.org/main/benefits-rates/ If you are an adult you'll pay $58 a month, and you can play soccer once a week, so you are paying $14.50 a game, plus you can use the whole YMCA (swimming pool, weights gym, yoga, etc). If you do the family plan you'll pay $84 for wife and kids. If we get at least 8 new members the YMCA will waive the signing fee for us and give us priority to sign up for the soccer class. Keep in mind that once the soccer class is open a lot of people that are already members who will want to sign up, and places are limited. I need please an answer before this Friday, Jan 8. Places are limited. Act fast!!
results.name: Nyack Soccer Meetup - YMCA

topics.name: Adults Taking Care of Aging Parents

results.description:
Want to make this the year when you finally start taking as good care of yourself, as you have everyone else in your life? Want to have more energy, improved health, and develop positive stress management skills, but the idea of joining a gym or going on yet another "doomed to failure" diet, are big turnoffs? Then this is the Meetup for you!!
Want to develop the physical, and emotional tools necessary to live functionally, and independently as you navigate the aging process? Then this is the Meetup for you!!
Through the combination of evidenced-based health and fitness exercises and information*, presented by a Certified Health Coach and Senior Fitness Specialist who will also facilitate group interaction and support, you can begin to make realistic and sustainable changes to your physical and psychological health!! * - As with any physical fitness activity, medical clearance is strongly recommended. As well as, informing the Health Coach of any pre-existing health concerns.
results.name: Senior "Fitness For Your Life" Meetup

results.description: Getting together for a purpose and it's to empower, guide and mentor young adults women. This group is designed to increase the degree of autonomy and self-determination in the lives of people of the Bronx community. Come and join us. We will be giving some workshops on: Self- Development entrepreneurship Self-determination Encouragement Advice in different areas etc
results.name: Bronx Women's Empowerment Meetup

results.description: A group for anyone in the radio and podcasting business to talk shop with other radio/podcasting nerds about the industry. We are dedicated to making the industry and each other better by sharing our ideas and experiences, while also getting our buzz on.
results.name: New York Radio Meetup

results.description: This is a group for New Yorkers who are looking for a more empowered, aware, and purposeful approach to life. Where your mind, heart, and body are all aligned for optimal performance and presence. Where we can gather together to share our passions with others. We don't strive for work/life balance as much as work/life integration because we believe work should be much more than just a paycheck. Most of us have tried living compartmentalized lives. You have your job, you have your friends, you have your personal beliefs, and for the most part you keep them separate because it's easier to manage that way. But eventually it gets tiring to try and keep all the plates spinning and the returns are diminishing. If you're looking for some more inspiration and purpose, come join us! We don't claim to have solutions. We believe, in the words of Joseph Campbell, that we're not really seeking the meaning of life, what we’re really seeking is "an experience of being alive." This group is for anyone who wants to be a part of exploring such experiences through finding fun, casual events throughout the city that can expand our consciousness and understanding of our own minds, emotions, and bodies.
results.name: NYC Integrate Your Life

results.description: It takes a village to raise a family! I don't have any family around so I want to find other families to enjoy the ride with. I want this group to be one of fun, friendship and support. We can share upcoming events, have play dates and adult time. I want us to be able to hang out at each others' houses as well as go out. As a mother of 3 young children, I am never alone, but am somehow very lonely. Am I the only one? Let's form our own "village"!
results.name: It takes a Village, Bergen County!

results.description: This group is for those who have a wide range of hobbies. I created this group to bring like-minded people together so they could build friendships starting from the things they enjoy doing and to introduce new activities for those who are curious about trying new things. This group will not fit into one single category due to my very diverse taste in hobbies. I look forward to making great friends in the New York area with you very fine people. A simple "Hi" could go a very long way.
results.name: Diverse NY Friends

results.description: This meet up group, is for people to learn how to motivate themselves and become self empowered. Our journey in life is full of amazing posabilitys and what ever we want we can have. Life is meant to be abundant and beautiful. learn how to start motivating yourself and loving yourself.
results.name: Middle Village Self-Empowerment Meetup

results.description: Why Join AITP? AITP is the leading worldwide society of professionals in information technology. We meet monthly at a dinner meeting and have presentations on the latest innovations and trends for IT Professionals. We are open to all levels and have no restrictions on membership. We also hold an annual Career Panel at our June meetings. Want to keep up to date on what is happening in the IT world, come to one of our meetings. Educate yourself with member-only webinars and conferences. Enjoy member discounts through our partner and affiliate programs. Search and apply to jobs through the AITP Career Center. Network with Information Technology leaders at local chapter meetings and through the AITP online community. Stay up-to-date with industry trends through AITP's Information Executive Newsletter
results.name: AITP - Association of Information Technology Professionals

results.description: Hi, folks. I am trying to start a writing group for aspiring writers who live within 10-mile radius of Fort Lee. There are a few established writing meetups in New Jersey but the closest one is 30 miles away. Therefore, I am trying to see if I can organize a group of writers closer to home. All age and experiences are welcome I've looked at some other writer's groups and this is the problem that I have with them: 1. There are some writing meetups that you show up and you write. I think that's pretty dumb because I can write at home, why would I travel to a meetup to write? 2. There are other meetups that take place in people's private homes because they don't have a regular location. This gets pretty confusing because I'll be going to a new house at every meetup. 3. There are some meetups that limit the work that we can bring to 2 pages or 1000 words. This is pointless because my shortest work is 5 pages long. 4. Most other writers’ meetups are non-critiquing. What's the point of going to a writer's meetup if you can't get any feedback? Therefore, my meetup will be a constructive critiquing meetup at a regular location (Dunkin' Donuts, Starbucks, or similar style coffee shops) every week. The suggested limit on the work is anything from a minimum of 1000 words (roughly 2 pages, single space, font size 11) to a maximum of 2500 words (roughly 5 pages, single space, font size 11). Each member will check the RSVP page before coming and bring enough copies for the number of people going. We will meet on every Saturday at a given time. Members will be required to buy a cup of coffee or pastry at the location since it is for paying customers only.
results.name: Fort Lee Book writing Meetup

results.description: This group is for those who appreciate all that Staten Island has to offer. We will try to do everything and anything as a group activity while keeping things social. I am always up for any ideas.

results.description: There are many different life experiences that may cause grief, including loss of a loved one, divorce or end of a relationship, aging parents or unwell family members, job loss, career transition, moving, and loss of health and well-being. Regardless of the type of loss you've experienced, if you're grieving and want to move forward, this group is for you. Step by step, I'll walk you through a method specifically designed to help people say goodbye to the pain they've experienced and get complete with the situation.
results.name: Grief Recovery Method Meetup

results.description: Being single, 30 and over, in the city can be lonely.  This group is specifically for those located in the NYC that are 30yrs of age and older who are single and seeking a social group comprised of other singles. This group will provide a safe space for members who are interested in meeting once a month for a social outlet/support w/other singles 30 and over. For example, outings/meetings will include group recreation meet-ups, group walking trips, movie meet ups, lunch outings, etc. The main purpose is to bring like minded, mature and respectful, singles together who are interested in meeting new people who are also 30 and over for social outlet and support while living single w/in the 5 boroughs. However, meetings will primarily be hosted in Bronx and/or Manhattan locations.

results.description:
This is a group for those who are ready to lose the extra weight and keep it off for good in a healthy and balanced way. We believe in accountability and when you surround yourself with like-minded people who have the same goals, your success will be that much greater. Compete in Our 6 week Nutrition Class and "Weight Loss Challenge" where you can Lose weight and Win money $$$. You will get a FREE Wellness Analysis, FREE Personal Wellness Coach, FREE Nutrition Classes & Exercise Information, FREE Group Support, Weekly Prizes and much more! Our last challenge paid out over $250 in prize money to top losers. This is a 6 week Nutrition Class and Weight Loss Challenge. 

For those not competitive, no problem, join us for the class.

results.description:
For over 15 years, the NYC .NET Developers Group has been the definitive community for .NET Developers in the New York City Metropolitan area. Each month, we bring you top speakers, free product giveaways, and great community networking, all for free. We meet the 3rd Thursday of each month at the NY Microsoft Offices at 11 Times Square (West 41st Street and 8th Avenue), 6th Floor.

Our group is run by well known experts in Microsoft technologies, including Microsoft MVPs and the Microsoft Regional Director for New York and New Jersey. Our own enthusiasm for the .NET platform and our close relationship with Redmond, Microsoft NY/NJ and the third-party .NET community ensure great speakers and great information.

The NYC .NET Developers Group now has a new home on Meetup, formerly hosted at http://www.nycdotnetdev.com.
results.name: NYC .NET Developers

results.description: Gypsy Yogis is a Yoga/Art studio focusing on enriching the lives of it's local community through wellness for the mind, body and soul. We have events monthly consisting of music, art, dance, shamanic practices and yoga. Located conveniently outside the Lincoln Tunnel we are a stone's throw away from Manhattan. Come experience a taste of true Bohemia right in your backyard.

results.description: Live More Adventures is about bringing people together to enjoy the outdoor world. Our trips are based on outdoor activities you are already passionate and created in a way to introduce you to new ones. Each adventure incorporates social elements to create lifetime connections in the best possible way. We take care of all aspects of each event - from one of a kind lodging to the gourmet non-stop food and everything else you need. You're free to thoroughly enjoy your time away from the real world and the time with your new friends.

results.description: I have a son who doesn't like video games or Sunday night football. Instead, he prefers going out to good ethnic restaurants, watching foreign movies, discovering cultural events in New York City, or watching theater and dance in Lincoln Center. Unfortunately, finding other families who also enjoy these things is truly very difficult. His interests, which are similar to mine, inspired me to start such a group. I'm a single mom of an older teenager, and would love company to explore NYC & NJ, with other families. I'd like to plan monthly events, and they will involve a variety of things listed above. I'd like us to "get out and do something", but with other families and their kids, who may also have similar interests. Come join me-- it will be an adventure.

results.description:
Learn Growth Marketing Tactics for 2016

There’s no denying that growth marketing is hot and here to stay. But despite the buzz, many businesses still don’t have the framework they need to build a successful growth marketing engine. 

Join a community of data-driven marketers and innovative entrepreneurs who will learn the fundamentals of rapid growth and digital marketing best practices, and growth hacking tactics for success.

https://youtu.be/HqKgXEG9z8k

This meetup is brought to you by:

Startup Socials - a global community of entrepreneurs built by entrepreneurs who are passionate about connecting, empowering people in the startup ecosystem. We host social and educational events around the globe where you can network, learn and create new relationships for your current and future startup ventures.

Growth Marketing Conference - the largest social media and growth marketing education event for entrepreneurs and startups. 

Startup Sales Conference - dozens of conferences tell you how to acquire leads and have conversations. This one actually tells you how to close deals.

Follow US

----------------------------------------------------------------------

Startup Socials: Facebook Twitter Instagram

Groups: Facebook LinkedIn Google+

results.description: We are striving to become NYC's premier Cook Book Club. Think of it as a regular monthly book club but focusing on cookbooks and meeting once a month with a potluck of dishes from the featured book of the month. Some months will include visits and book signings from guest chefs. While vegan, raw, gluten free, or kosher recipes are sure to be included there will be no official dietary restrictions on this group. Books for the upcoming month will be voted on at the end of each meeting. We are partnering up with Kitchen Arts & Letters to acquire the books. There will most likely be a discount available to group members on the featured cookbook, but more on that to come. The goal here is to create a core group of 20-25 food minded friends to get together and expand our culinary horizons. Location TBA.
results.name: NYC CookBook Club

results.description: Are you seeking deeper connections? Do you identify as Spiritual but not Religious? Are you looking to find balance in the busyness of everyday living and exploring spiritual paths and practices with others? results.description: You are a professional in the Marketing Automation space, and you want to meet similar specialists, managers and directors in the space. You want to learn more about the differences between Eloqua and Pardot or Marketo and Hubspot. What makes a strong marketing team? What makes companies complementary and more effective? How do you efficiently design a marketing strategy that is collaborative with your sales team? In the larger picture, how do you build a great team and build great products that customers can engage with? This group is for marketing automation professionals and amateurs who are curious to figure out what tools are on the market and how different companies and startups are utilizing these technologies to strategize sales and growth.

results.description: Hey there! We're Chris, Billy, Jason, Jenny and Justin. We make up team Pundit, one of the coolest new startups in NYC. Pundit is the simplest way for you to speak your mind using your real voice. We believe the authenticity of the human voice is missing from today’s social media, and Pundit is here to change that. Pundit is a Disney and Techstars backed company with a full voice platform launching really soon. But enough about us, we want to hear from you! So without further adieu, you're cordially invited to come hang out. Every other Friday, we open our doors to you - the superstars. We're looking to bud heads and share war stories with fellow app developers, social media enthusiasts, bloggers, podcasters, audio professionals, and students. We're a social network for voice, and if that interests you in any capacity, you've found the right Meetup!

results.description: Private group with a guide and a cook hike to Lost City in Columbia. Lost City is older them Machu Picchu! 30 miles in 4 days hiking through out the jungle is an unforgettable experience enjoying the stunning views and meeting local tribes. Who else is in? I am setting up a group of around 6-8 people to go to Columbia by probably end of February - beginning of March. Dates are still being worked out. Let's meet for a drink, try it out at a local 10-12 mile hike, set up a date and have a blast in Columbia. I will take care of logistics. The trek on its own is ca $400-450, which includes food, snacks and accommodations. You will have to fly to Santa Marta, Columbia. Let's have an adventure!
results.name: Lost City in Columbia, 4 day trek

results.description: Pub Theology is honest conversation with people about things that matter. We gather together around the community table at The Edge Harlem for community, conversation and food and drink. We listen and approach each other prepared to learn from each other. The format is simple: beer, conversation and Good. Everything is up for discussion, no assumptions, no barriers to entry. Here we have a chance to learn, grow and expand. How could you go wrong with beer, conversation and God?
results.name: Harlem Pub Theology @ The Edge Harlem

results.description: I am starting this group as a test run. Not only is this group for single moms to support each other, but also for all moms to serve as a type of assistance with babysitting, and for the single Moms who are looking to get back out in life without just play dates. We are allowed to enjoy time away from the kids, but this support group can serve as assistance to each other, and support for each other when needed.  Please always feel free to assist with ideas, and play dates are always welcome as well. I would like to try to get monthly meet and greets set up, so we can begin networking with each other and helping each other out. We all know how hard it is to be a mom, single or married and trying to stay sane, so why not help each other out!

results.description:
This is a group for anyone in the LGBTQ community, or friends alike, who is interested in Craft Beer...and the art of DRINKING craft beer. In Partnership with Alewife Craft Beer Bar in Long Island City, NY, we are looking to bring the LIC and Astoria LGBT community together through tasty local brews at a crazy great Happy Hour price all night long.

Reason you should join this meetup: If you are interested in Craft Beer and are looking to meet people within the community, this meetup is for you! Whether it's friendship, a spark, a bottle share, or some nerdy yeast loving talk... This meetup is for anyone who likes or wants to learn more about the growing craft beer movement within a safe environment. 

Things we'll be doing: Beer tastings, beer dinners, tasting competitions, larger social events for charity, holiday parties, seasonal events, and more! Suggestions and ideas are ALWAYS welcome, but mainly the events will be held in Long Island City, or participating craft beer bars/breweries around Queens and even in Manhattan.

We hope you'll join! See you soon :)

I'm making parties every week/weekend. Text me now 917-443-3829 to party in the city which never sleep and feel like a star by skipping the lines for free!! Have a birthday? Text me now!! Will make it special for you and your people!! I guarantee you won't forget it!! JOIN NOW AND CELEBRATE YOUR LIFE!! https://www.facebook.com/carolinejanenyc ;D

results.description: This group is for anyone who loves ethnic food and food from other countries. No matter the country, NYC has the food for it (except poor little Khazakstan....no Khazak restaurants in NYC yet:( But other than that, it's a go! You are guaranteed to have food that you have never had before, and maybe you have never heard of before. Some meals will be more adventurous than others, but there is something for everyone in this group. We will discover together the best ethnic and international food in NYC.
results.name: Around the world with food

results.description: TEPTU aims to find the most innovative students in the realms of S.T.E.M. research and entrepreneurship. This year, high school students from New York City and South Africa will be showcasing their projects and competing with one another. Teptu Brink is much more than a research competition. It is an opportunity builder for the upcoming leaders in Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics. It bridges the gap between what seems like a distant dream and reality. Join the Teptu movement as our applicants take leaps and bounds toward the advancement of S.T.E.M. research. Become a Teptu Pioneer and take part in our first annual S.T.E.M. competition. Teptu Brink 2016 will take place in NYC. This year’s top awards include cash prizes, trophies and long-term mentorships.
results.name: TEPTU Science Research Finals Competition

results.description: I am a first time mom due in early Feb 2016 and looking to meet other mom friends in the area for play dates, mom's night out etc. Let's get together to share new mom experiences, advice and support for each other.
